alert.note: Alert for Inyo (California) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS LasVegas (Southern Nevada, Southeastern California, Northwestern Arizona)
info.headline: Flood Advisory issued March 10 at 7:02AM PST until March 10 at 12:30PM PST by NWS LasVegas
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 7 PM PST THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of southeast California, including the following county, Inyo. * WHEN...Until 700 PM PST Friday. * IMPACTS...Rises in small streams and normally dry washes. Water over roadways. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 702 AM PST, CHP reported water over Old Sherwin Grade Road and Gorge Road, about 15 miles northwest of Bishop. An automated gage recorded a rapid rise on Rock Creek near the Owens River. Flooding is ongoing and will expand around the northern Owens Valley and Bishop area as creeks and streams rise with continued rainfall and snow melt. Between 1 and 2 inches of rain have fallen so far. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Roads around Bishop and the northern Owens Valley. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be aware of your surroundings and do not drive on flooded roads.
